alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County South Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 22 at 3:19PM PST until February 23 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...West to northwest winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph expected. Winds strongest in the west canyons and hills. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County South Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will make driving difficult. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Major roadways that will be impacted by strong winds include Highways 101, 154 and 192...as well as the Gaviota and San Marcos Passes.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
